oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brick work showing name of company
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Close-up view of brick work showing name of company at Bear Spring Furnace, four miles east of Dover at Bear Spring. View of north side.

The original charcoal cold-blast furnace was built in 1830 by Woods, Yeatman & Co. as part of Cumberland Iron Works. By 1850, the furnace produced over 2000 tons of metal. In 1862, the stack was destroyed by Union troops, and it was reconstructed in 1873.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Blast furnaces; Metallurgical furnaces
Furnaces
